title: Merck, Pfizer spur S&P 500 to record high; Alphabet weighs on Nasdaq
text:
Merck, Pfizer spur S&P 500 to record high; Alphabet weighs on Nasdaq

Stock Markets 23 minutes ago (Oct 29, 2019 10:55AM ET)

© Reuters. FILE PHOTO: Traders work on the floor at the NYSE in New York (Reuters) - The S&P 500 hit a fresh record high on Tuesday, lifted by upbeat earnings from drugmakers Merck and Pfizer (NYSE: ), while disappointing quarterly profit from Google-parent Alphabet (NASDAQ: ) kept the Nasdaq firmly in the negative territory. At 10:45 a.m. ET, the Dow Jones Industrial Average ( ) was up 48.19 points, or 0.18%, at 27,138.91, while the S&P 500 ( ) was up 5.47 points, or 0.18%, at 3,044.89. The Nasdaq Composite ( ) was down 16.34 points, or 0.20%, at 8,309.64.

Merck, Pfizer spur S&P 500 to record high; Alphabet weighs on Nasdaq
